snippet: Walking through the dark ruins of a defunct Soviet installation brings back memories of the Cuban missile crisis and makes apparent the continuing possibility of a nuclear attack.
abstract: George Johnson Raw Data column recalls physical relics of Cold War-era nuclear fears; describes visit to Russian Woodpecker, transmission tower on Ukraine border that was intended to provide early warning of United States nuclear attack; notes that while collective fear of nuclear war has diminished, threat has grown.
lead_paragraph: Walking through the dark ruins of a defunct Soviet installation brings back memories of the Cuban missile crisis and makes apparent the continuing possibility of a nuclear attack.

headline.print_headline: A Time for Revisiting Real Fears
headline.seo: Sobering Relics of a Nuclear Threat That Has Spread
headline.main: A Time for Revisiting Real Fears
